title: How to Make Smoked Salmon Blinis

steps.headline: Boil the peas.
steps.description: Place the peas in a pan of boiling water and allow it them to boil for 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Blanch the peas.
steps.description: Drain out the peas and immediately place them in a bowl of ice cold water. Drain again.

steps.headline: Puree the peas.
steps.description: Add them to a blender or food processor and puree them until smooth. Add the flour, baking soda, baking powder, mint leaves, and eggs.

steps.headline: Blend everything together.
steps.description: Pour in the milk, in divided amounts, until you have a smooth batter.

steps.headline: Preheat an oiled frying pan over medium heat.
Spoon the batter into the pan.
steps.description: Create small to medium size circles in the pan.

steps.headline: Allow the batter to cook for about 3 minutes.
steps.description: Wait until bubbles appear on the top surface and the outsides begin to set. Flip them and cook for another minute. Watch the heat of the pan, as the hotter the pan becomes, discoloration will appear and the blinis will burn faster.

steps.headline: Continue with the rest of the batter.
steps.description: Be sure to slightly wipe the pan between each frying.

parts.name: Make the Crème Fraiche Mixture and Assemble

steps.headline: Combine the crème fraiche with the dill.
steps.description: In a small bowl, whisk them together with the lemon zest.

steps.headline: Season the mixture.
steps.description: Sprinkle salt and pepper in the mixture for taste.

steps.headline: Arrange the blinis.
steps.description: Cut the smoked salmons into ribbons and fold on top of your blinis. Top with a spoonful of crème fraiche and a sprig of dill.

text: Make the Blini Batter Boil the peas. Place the peas in a pan of boiling water and allow it them to boil for 3 minutes. Blanch the peas. Drain out the peas and immediately place them in a bowl of ice cold water. Drain again. Puree the peas. Add them to a blender or food processor and puree them until smooth. Add the flour, baking soda, baking powder, mint leaves, and eggs. Blend everything together. Pour in the milk, in divided amounts, until you have a smooth batter. Fry the Blinis Preheat an oiled frying pan over medium heat.  Spoon the batter into the pan. Create small to medium size circles in the pan. Allow the batter to cook for about 3 minutes. Wait until bubbles appear on the top surface and the outsides begin to set. Flip them and cook for another minute. Watch the heat of the pan, as the hotter the pan becomes, discoloration will appear and the blinis will burn faster. Continue with the rest of the batter. Be sure to slightly wipe the pan between each frying. Make the Crème Fraiche Mixture and Assemble Combine the crème fraiche with the dill. In a small bowl, whisk them together with the lemon zest. Season the mixture. Sprinkle salt and pepper in the mixture for taste. Arrange the blinis. Cut the smoked salmons into ribbons and fold on top of your blinis. Top with a spoonful of crème fraiche and a sprig of dill.
